jobs.title: UI Artist
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Wanted: Colonist UI Artist

Working Hours: We work asynchronously and value outcomes over hours

Location: Fully Remote, Anywhere in the world

Compensation:

  • Competitive salary paid in USD

  • Negotiable range based on experience and location

  • Stock (own a piece of Colonist)

About Colonist

We're building the biggest digital board game platform on the internet. Last year, our players spent 2,466 years playing 45 million games on our Settlers of Catan alternative. We're a fully remote, asynchronous team spread across multiple continents, focused on crafting extremely polished digital board games that people truly love.

About The Role

As a UI Artist at Colonist, you’ll bring our digital board game to life through beautiful visuals, cohesive style, and expressive animation. Your work will make every interaction visually engaging, creating a look and feel that keeps millions of players immersed in the world of strategy, competition, and fun.

What You'll Do

  • Work closely with a dynamic, cross-functional team to drive design decisions that enhance the user experience

  • Independently create high-quality UI designs that set a new standard for creativity and usability

  • Leverage tools like Figma and other cutting-edge design platforms to ideate, prototype, and refine designs

Requirements

  • 5+ years of experience as a UI Artist in the gaming industry

  • Proficiency in Figma or similar design tools

  • Expertise in interaction and motion design, animation principles, and 2D asset implementation

  • Strong understanding of game mechanics across various genres and accessibility best practices

  • Solid grasp of graphic design principles and game sound design

Nice to Have

  • Familiarity with game engines (e.g., Unity, Unreal)

  • Basic scripting knowledge for prototyping (e.g., C#, JavaScript)

Our Values at Colonist

We strongly adhere to these values in our team - if these resonate, then you’ll love working here!

Dependability

We're self-driven players who deliver without needing supervision. When we commit to something, we make it happen.

Ownership

We take full responsibility and go beyond our roles to improve Colonist. Each of us acts like we own the company, because through our stock options, we do.

Clear Communication

In our remote environment, written communication is key. We're direct, structured, and always keep our team in the loop.

Efficient Execution

We move fast and focus on impact. Instead of getting stuck on perfect solutions, we find practical ways forward and get things done.

Continuous Learning

We're curious problem solvers who love a challenge. We constantly seek new ideas, embrace feedback, and aren't afraid to change our minds when we're wrong.

Benefits and Compensation

Compensation

  • Competitive salary paid in USD

  • Stock (own a piece of Colonist)

Benefits

  • Fully remote team spread across multiple time zones

  • Flexible hours - we work asynchronously and value outcomes over hours

  • Unlimited vacation

  • Yearly offsite

  • Work equipment provided

Growth

  • Work directly impacts 5M+ yearly active players

  • Rapid learning opportunities

  • Work with exceptional colleagues on challenging projects

  • Freedom to identify and solve problems

  • Access to all company metrics and discussions

  • Expect deep work and autonomy with clear expectations and accountability

jobs.title: Engineering Lead
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Wanted: Colonist Engineering Lead

Working Hours: We work asynchronously and value outcomes over hours

Location: Fully Remote, Anywhere in the world

Compensation:

  • Competitive salary paid in USD.

  • Negotiable range based on experience and location

  • Stock (own a piece of Colonist)

About Colonist

We're building the biggest digital board game platform on the internet. Last year, our players spent 2,466 years playing 45 million games on our Settlers of Catan alternative. We're a fully remote, asynchronous team spread across multiple continents, focused on crafting extremely polished digital board games that people truly love.

About The Role

As a Engineering Lead at Colonist, your mission is to own our increasing technical complexity by making sound architectural decisions, improving development processes, and raising the technical bar across the organization. This is a high-impact leadership role for someone who thrives on systems thinking, architectural clarity and positively impacting millions of players.

What You’ll Do

  • Architect a unified codebase for multi-platform and multi-game support, ensuring seamless functionality across Web, Mobile, Discord, and Steam

  • Expand and scale the codebase to support multiple game titles efficiently

  • Evolve our TypeScript + Node.js + React + WebSocket systems for scalability, maintainability, and performance

  • Shape our system design and infrastructure direction with long-term clarity in mind

  • Identify and remove bottlenecks in CI/CD, testing, and deployment reliability

  • Mentor team members and help them reach mastery

  • Raise technical standards by ensuring code quality, best practices, and documentation are maintained across projects

  • Build and maintain a high-performing team

  • Translate company and product goals into clear engineering plans and deliverables

  • Strengthen our engineering values, encourage ownership, and scale a culture of continuous learning

Requirements

  • 7+ years of professional software development experience

  • Proven experience leading or managing engineers

  • Deep expertise in TypeScript, React, Node.js, and WebSocket systems

  • Strong understanding of system architecture, scalability, and maintainability

  • Experience improving CI/CD pipelines, release processes, and team workflows

  • Clear, structured written communication (async collaboration is our norm)

  • Demonstrated ability to mentor and coach others

  • Proven ability to elevate software development teams' technical standards

  • Strong judgment and decisiveness under uncertainty

Nice to Have

  • Experience in real-time multiplayer or game backend systems

  • Open-source contribution or technical community engagement

  • Background in remote-first or async teams

Disclaimer: This talent pool is not tied to an active role. It exists for candidates interested in joining Colonist when a relevant opportunity opens up. Please note that we can't guarantee if or when we'll reach out.

Location: Fully Remote

We're a fully remote, asynchronous team spread across multiple continents, focused on crafting extremely polished digital board games that people truly love.

What We're Looking For

Individuals with an unstoppable mentality who can thrive in a fast-paced environment. Working here won't be easy — it's not a 9-5 role in a big company. It comes with a lot of hard work and long hours. But with that, comes more impact, learnings, and growth than anywhere else. We want people who aren't just looking for another job but are excited about building something new, increasing their skills and taking on bigger projects.   • Be a logical and independent problem solver

  • A team player - you are adaptable, proactive and highly responsive

  • A gamer with strong judgment

  • Be relentless, driven & hands-on - you get things done despite limited resources or circumstances going against you

jobs.title: Product Manager - Game
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Wanted: Colonist Product Manager

Working Hours: We work asynchronously and value outcomes over hours

Location: Fully Remote, Anywhere in the world

Compensation:

  • Competitive salary paid in USD.

  • Negotiable range based on experience and location

  • Stock (own a piece of Colonist)

About Colonist

We're building the biggest digital board game platform on the internet. Last year, our players spent 2,466 years playing 45 million games on our Settlers of Catan alternative. We're a fully remote, asynchronous team spread across multiple continents, focused on crafting extremely polished digital board games that people truly love.

About The Role

As a Product Manager at Colonist, you’ll own high-impact product work across mobile and web, focused on improving onboarding, retention, and game completion. You’ll turn player insights into smart, scalable solutions — balancing fun, simplicity, and performance. Working async with a small, fast team, you’ll drive strategy, execution, and outcomes for a game played by millions.

What You’ll Do

  • Optimize user activation funnels by identifying drop-offs, validating hypotheses, and shipping improvements.

  • Investigate mobile product issues using user feedback, crash reports, and behavioral data.

  • Conduct user interviews, playtests, and qualitative research to inform product decisions.

  • Prioritize and scope features based on simplicity, impact, and company goals.

  • Improve game completion rates through design iterations and player motivation insights.

  • Break down complex projects into clear, testable steps and align teams around execution.

  • Improve onboarding, landing pages, and community-driven features to support growth.

  • Collaborate asynchronously with founders, engineers, and designers to drive product outcomes.

Requirements

  • 7+ years of product management experience, ideally in gaming

  • Proficiency in funnel analysis, A/B testing, and user segmentation

  • Strong experience with user interviews, playtesting, and qualitative analysis

  • Deep understanding of mobile product development and UX best practices

  • Clear, structured written communication for async collaboration

  • SQL proficiency (joins, group by) for data-driven decision making

  • Demonstrated ability to prioritize, scope, and deliver product improvements quickly

  • Familiarity with game design, player behavior, and motivating user engagement

Nice to Have

  • Familiarity with crash reports and debugging tools

  • Experience with AI chatbots for user engagement

  • Ability to read code for deeper collaboration with devs

  • Forum/community moderation or support experience

Our Values at Colonist

We strongly adhere to these values in our team - if these resonate, then you’ll love working here!

Dependability

Ownership

Clear Communication

Efficient Execution

Continuous Learning
